Summary: Layer-service still using layer.properties in WEB-INF/classes

comment.text:
Layer-service still using layer.properties in WEB-INF/classes as opposed to solely relying on external config,

This was the problem on dev.

i.text: (No comment was entered for this change.)

Summary: Home page tab for DoE only custom reports

comment.text:
DoE have a requirement for a number of specific operational reports to be generated on-call from MERIT data. These are different from dashboard activity-based reports and includes, though not limited to:
1) current user list sortable/filterable by user role and permission - this is need for assessing periodic clean-up of internal staff access and permissions.
2) Project stats by state - needed for monitoring DoE regional office operational efficiency
etc.

Specific requirements, presentation styles, and more report types still to come.
has been merged into this issue.

i.text: (No comment was entered for this change.)

Summary: Implement different styling colours between DEV, TEST and PROD environments

comment.text:
With implementation of the Demonstrator project in the test environment, some users are finding it difficult to differentiate between the PROD and TEST environments. 

DoE has requested that we change the style colours in TEST to make it distinctly different from PROD.

Short term fix to prevent confusion would be to remove users from all projects in TEST (except the Demonstrator project). This will remove the test projects from the users' "My projects" list and allow them to only see the overview page for their projects in test. This should be adequate to highlight that they are in the wrong environment.
We could put the demonstrator project into prod?
Short term fix implemented.  All user permissions have been removed on test.

Summary: Change 'State' spatial filter from just the terrestrial state layer to state terrestrial plus adjacent coastal waters

comment.text: When applying the 'state' filter, project/activity sites which occur offshore (eg. GB Reef, Torres Straight, etc.) are excluded from the selection and hance the result set. This issue has been raised several times by DoE.
has been merged into this issue.

Summary: Support for multiple project funding sources

comment.text:
New doE programmes require projects to be apportioned across multiple funding streams. This is also a requirement of the generalised system as many projects undertaken by organisations involve multiple funding partners.

A simple multi-row table in the Admin>Project information tab should be adequate for this putpose.
Incorrectly assigned issue type.

Summary: Provide ability to associate 0-many sites with one activity

comment.text:
DoE has requested this capability to provide more accurate geotagging of data for the multi-event/multi-action activities.

Needs carefult thought as to how to implement to ensure that usability and data entry efficiency are maximised and not compromised at all. It is also currently unclear as to where the process efficiency gains will be achieved for users in this model.

i.text: (No comment was entered for this change.)

Summary: Ability to create a "mother/parent" project for regional delivery type projects

comment.text:
In cases such as regional delivery types of projects, DoE has requested the ability to create a 'mother/parent' project which allows proponents to report outcomes, issues and progress at a master project (head agreement) level.

A short-term work around for this would be to create a project shell within the existing design framework in which the only activities are reporting activities and which has links to each of the sub-projects in the 'project stories' section of the overview page. 

Ideally something more robust and specifically designed is probably desirable, but would need to consider implications around re-use of information in sub-projects for process stream-lining, dashboard and numeric data/metrics impacts, activity relationships and the consistency of schedules and aggregated data (eg. parent and sub-project costs, targets, etc.), the flow-on implications of add activities and data to both the parent and sub-projects, etc.

Summary: Ability to colour-code sites/dots on maps by selected attribute facets

comment.text:
DoE requirement

This request is for simple facet-based colouring of sites/dots on the fieldcapture home page map, similar to that provided on the ALA BIE records map. 

A specific case requested would be for differentiation between programmes displayed on the map, but there are also other attributes where colour differentiation would significantly add value to the mapped view. These are to be provided following further analysis.

Summary: Management Practice Change output: aggregate select list classes into reporting classes

comment.text:
Need to aggregate some select list classes for industryType to enable reporting at an aggregate level for horticulture and broadacre cropping. 

This will involve adding aggregation JSON to the 'Management Practice Change Details' output data model.

Summary: Retain activity header data entered after moving focus into output sections

comment.text:
MERIT user notified issue:

Whenever we edit some information in an Activity, it makes us re-enter the 'Actual Start' and 'Actual Finish' dates for that Activity before it will save the new information we have entered. Why aren't the Actual Start and Finish dates we've previously entered not retained like all other information we have entered?

Need to test!

Summary: Unexpected error message when deleting an activity

comment.text:
Issue reported by user:

Error message displays when deleting activity: 'Failed to delete activity: error 500'. Refreshing page reveals the deletion does work, but it throws an error message. E.g. RGD14-012E-4 and LSP-991913-1432

Need to test!

Summary: Enable projects to be 'closed' and selectively filtered in search/display results

comment.text:
DoE requirement #122

Need to be able to flag projects as 'finished' or 'closed' and to selectively filter them individually or together in/out of filtered search results.

Currently awaiting a definition of a 'closed' project from DoE.

Summary: print function does not copy across populated fields after entering data

comment.text:
User submitted issue (via DoE):

The print function does not copy across populated fields after entering data to the field or once the Activity progress status is ‘finished’.

Need to test!

Summary: User could submit a stage report with "Started" activity status on some activities

comment.text:
User submitted issue (via DoE #99):

Project LSP 876 submitted a report even though there were activities listed as "Started".

Need to test!

Summary: Project outputs are incongruent with project dashboard and not updating correctly

comment.text:
User submitted issue (via DoE #36):

The project outputs do not display correctly and appear not to necessarily guide the project dashboard.

Values in the project dashboard are also not updating correctly.

See MERIT Demonstrator project in TEST

I've had a quick look at the demonstrator.
1) The project doesn't appear to have any (non-zero) output targets.
2) The project has several activities that have end dates before the start of stage 1.  This results in the activities not being displayed on the plan, however they are still used for reporting.

Probably some kind of warning is needed when adjusting the project dates so that activities are excluded to prevent this kind of confusion.

Summary: Grant manager not receiving stage report notification email

comment.text:
User submitted issue (via DoE #127):

Grant managers did not receive an email notifying that report for project Grant Id: X0000004479G had been submitted. 

Need to test!

Summary: New tab on project activities page - Output Reconciliation

comment.text:
Insert a new tab next to the Gantt chart view on the Activities page for a stage-based reconciliation view of output targets. Design still to be provided.

This task is dependednt on implementation of
and should ideally be done in conjunction with that task.

i.text: (No comment was entered for this change.)

Summary: Ability to insert a javascript widget (youtube, vimeo, etc) link to display and play embedded videos on the Overview page

comment.text:
DoE want to have more effective ways for people to be able to tell stories about the outcomes of their projects. One important mechanism for doing this is with videos and they want the ability to attach both links to external video sources as well as to embed playable clips within the project overview page and also within a "Stories" tab on the home page of MERIT.

This should be added via the project ADMIN tab and should display on the project Overview tab within the column of published images on the LHS of the page.

Design of the "Stories" tab for the MERIT home page is still to be developed.

Summary: Round off values of outputs (target and non-target) to integers only for display in dashboards

comment.text: Many numeric values for both target and non-target outputs are currently displaying in the dashboards with up to 10 decimal places. As aggregated values, it is only appropriate to display whole integer values in the dashboards.

Summary: Load Layer: Atlas of Australian Soils

comment.text: This layer fills a significant gap in the substrate arena in the ALA and will address a number of recent user requests.

Hi Lee,
This contextual layers has names like CA43, FU28 etc. This does not make much sense to me. I suppose the same problem will be faced by people who are not soil experts. Dereferencing it to something more meaningful is not possible since the explanatory text run to many characters. What is the best way forward. Please find the attached file to see what I mean.

tv

The notes don't align with the attached map on ASRIS called "Australian Soil Classification" (see attached) where there are 15 classes. 

I have however found a file (attached) on the ASRIS site that provides a lookup table from the Principal Profile Form (PPF) to the classification class and there is even a colour table for the classification classes. Hopefully this will work?

i.text: (No comment was entered for this change.)

Summary: Change labels for fields on Project Information edit page

comment.text:
The following label changes are required on the Project Information edit page for the Green Army programme. These are more general than the terms currently used and should also apply adequately for other programmes.

"Grant recipient"  change to   "Recipient"
"Funded by"  change to  "Programme"

A "Service provider" field also needs to be added to this page and this will also need to map into the "Organisation" facet on the site home page.

Summary: Add tutorial links and picklist settings to create project wizard

comment.text: There probably should be steps in the create new expedition wizard for tutorial links and selecting a Collection picklist code.

Summary: Help text in preview template shows escaped HTML

comment.text: Help text bubbles in the template preview are displaying html tags instead of rendering them.

Summary: Column name oddities in occurrences and species download

comment.text:
1. If I ask for "matched_name" or "lsid" in my list of fields to be returned, I don't get them back.

(try e.g.

)

2. If I leave the requested fields as their default values, I get the scientific name in a column called scientificName - all good. But if I actually specify the field "scientificName", I get something with all-lower case names and abbreviated genus:

scientificName
"aptenodytes"
"a. forsteri"
"a. patagonicus"

If I ask for "nameComplete", I get what appears to be the correct scientific name.

Summary: Scrape invasives information?

comment.text: I recently ran across three very good species profiling sites for invasive alien species. It would be really nice to be able to add links to the relevant species profiles

Summary: Load layer: Agroclimatic classification of Australia

comment.text:
In searching for a layer defining Australian terrestrial biomes, I was recommended Hutchinson et al's Agroclimatic classification. The shapefile has been supplied by Jannet Stein (co-author on the 2005 paper).

I'll need to create a metadata entry for this so if a preliminary entry could be made in the Layers Table, I'll fill in the remaining details.
